intro: Myrsine crassiramea, commonly known as the New Zealand myrsine, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small white flowers are followed by red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for native birds. It typically grows in coastal and lowland forest environments.
